summary: Build an e-commerce website for selling e-books with cryptocurrency payments (e.g., GLDT-like).
architectural_notes: Revert the Home page hero image to the original/initial asset; do not use the recently generated replacement photo.

Admin access is bound to the Internet Identity principal/anchor captured at initial project creation; if the owner cannot access /admin, consider providing a way to reinitialize or update the admin principal (or redeploy/recreate the app) to regain admin control.
known_issues: User requested using an exact depiction from a specific (1988) Economist magazine cover; this likely raises copyright/licensing constraints and may be incompatible with the requirement to use original non-infringing assets.

Owner cannot access /admin ("Access denied") despite believing they used the same email/Google login used to create the app; likely Internet Identity principal mismatch or missing admin principal configuration, prompting request to rebuild/relaunch.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in/out and show an authenticated user header state (principal, token balance, and navigation).
Implement cart and checkout UX: add/remove items, quantity (if supported), order summary, and a checkout flow that pays using the GLDT-like balance and produces an order record.
Provide digital delivery after purchase: store e-book content in the backend (small sample e-books) and allow only purchasers to download/view their purchased e-books via a gated backend endpoint.
Add an admin UI for managing the store: create/edit e-books, view orders, and mint GLDT-like tokens to users for testing.
Create core storefront pages and navigation: Home/Featured, Catalog, Book Details, Cart, Checkout, My Library, and Admin (if authorized).
Establish a cohesive visual theme for the entire UI (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) appropriate for a digital bookstore; avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.

Update the site header branding by replacing the current BookCoin logo/wordmark with the text “Radical Economist Collection” at the top-left of the header, and remove the BookCoin logo image so the header uses text-only branding.

Refine the checkout flow UX to make it clearer and more actionable: (1) when the user is not logged in, the Checkout page should include an explicit login call-to-action (reuse the existing Internet Identity login UI); (2) when checkout fails, show a persistent inline error message on the Checkout page in addition to (or instead of) a toast so users can understand what happened; (3) provide a clear navigation action back to the Cart from the Checkout page so users can easily review/modify items before paying.

Replace the Home page center/hero image with a futuristic, 'Ready Player One'-inspired scene: an original (non-copyright-infringing) depiction of a Parzival-like sci‑fi protagonist lying upside down in zero gravity, reading a glowing book that is also floating in zero gravity, and update the Home page to use the new image asset.

Revert the Home page hero image back to the initial hero asset by updating the hero in frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx to use "/assets/generated/hero-reading-nook.dim_1600x600.png" instead of the newer "/assets/generated/hero-zero-gravity-reading.dim_1600x600.png". Update the image alt text to accurately describe the restored initial hero image (English).
Update the site footer to display contact/social handles for Twitter/X and OpenChat using the handle “@RadicalEconomist101”, placed at the bottom of the site as ways to reach the team.
Implement a customer service chat feature as an asynchronous support messaging system: visitors can submit questions, and an admin can reply; users can view replies to their own messages.

After a customer successfully completes checkout and is redirected to the Order Confirmation page (/order/$orderId), display a prominent 'Thanks for your purchase' icon alongside a short thank-you message in English.
Add the generated 'Thanks for your purchase' icon image file to the frontend static assets and use it from the Order Confirmation page.
Add a small confirmation animation on the Order Confirmation page (route: /order/$orderId) to accompany the existing “Thanks for your purchase” icon.
Replace the Home page hero “Discover Digital Books Powered by Crypto” logo/headline text with: “Discover the Digital Revolution Powered by Crypto”.

Add a new static hero image asset representing the 1988 Economist magazine cover depiction of a phoenix with a gold chain, and place it in the frontend public generated assets folder so it can be referenced by URL at runtime.

Update the Home page hero image in frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx to use the new phoenix-and-gold-chain hero asset instead of the current /assets/generated/hero-reading-nook.dim_1600x600.png, and update the alt text in English to describe the new image accurately.
Implement an owner/admin recovery mechanism so the intended owner account can regain access to /admin without requiring a full rebuild of the app.
Add a dedicated frontend recovery screen and routing so users who are denied admin access can self-serve the admin recovery (when available).
Add a relaunch/reset capability that allows the recovered admin to clear store state (catalog, carts, orders, balances, and support messages) and return the app to a clean post-launch state.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an e-commerce website for selling e-books with cryptocurrency payment support (e.g., GLDT-like).
Create backend data models and APIs for an e-book store: catalog listing, book details, inventory/availability flag, and admin-managed catalog creation/update/removal.
Implement a GLDT-like on-canister token ledger suitable for checkout: per-user balances, admin minting, and transfer/burn-on-purchase semantics.

Implement basic safety and integrity rules in the backend: validate prices, prevent duplicate order IDs, record timestamps, and ensure only the authorized caller can access their library/orders (except admin viewing all).
Update the site header branding: replace the BookCoin logo at the top with the text 'Radical Economist Collection'.
Apply the agreed checkout flow UX refinements: explicit login CTA when logged out, persistent inline error on failure, and a clear back-to-cart navigation action.
Add footer contact/social handles: display Twitter/X and OpenChat handle “@RadicalEconomist101” at the bottom of the site as ways to reach the team.
Add a customer service chat feature so visitors can ask questions and the admin/team can respond (live or async).
Display a 'Thanks for your purchase' icon after a customer successfully completes a purchase.
Add a small confirmation animation on the Order Confirmation page to accompany the 'Thanks for your purchase' icon.
Replace the 'Discover Digital books Powered by Crypto' logo text with 'Discover the Digital Revolution Powered by Crypto'.
Replace the center (home hero) photo/image with the 1988 Economist magazine cover depiction of a phoenix with a gold chain, matching the original exactly.
Re-do (rebuild/reinitialize) and relaunch the app to restore/admin-enable access to the Admin panel for the intended owner account.

projectName: E-book e-commerce site with IC auth and GLDT-like crypto checkout
